description:
Wonderful service, absolutely delicious food. Love this neighborhood pizza joint! ;)

Go for the Libra pizza -- it's perfect in all ways. :)
author: Julie D.

description:
Ok pizza but terrible service. Routinely takes 2 hours to order 1 pizza and we live a few blocks away. Some times I even ask the delivery person and they always say its not busy. Huh???

I only ever eat here if I am passing by and can pick it up now. There are tons better pizza options in the Richmond that are also much faster to deliver.
author: Ken B.

description: I came back to yelp because of this restaurant. The 12 piece wings were so damned delicious. Can't say much to do them justice, go grab a dozen. The owner is a nice guy, too. This place was just... A feel good spot to grab a corner with homies and talk Star Wars, politics, and recent reading selections. I had a fine Saturday here, and you probably would too. I also had the meatball sandwich. Also tasty and well made. Man, just go here sometime.
author: Ketan H.

description: Ordered 3 different pizzas from their menu for pickup, all were great! The food was ready on time and the price was very reasonable. Staff was also friendly when we arrived. Would definitely order again! Highly recommend.
author: Dako L.

description:
Look, I'm a simple man with simple tastes. I enjoy long showers and cozy sweat pants, but when it comes to pizza I can be a handful. I like my pizza like I like my ladies: Hot and cheesy! But sometimes it's hard too find the perfect slice. But at Pizza Joint, every slice is the best slice! They know how to make great pizza at affordable prices! And they're just a breezy 10 minute walk away (at least for me, I don't know about you. I don't know where you live! Look it up yourself, person!). 

Five Stars!
author: Bobby S.

description: Meh. Bad crust, bad sauce, skimpy toppings very mediocre pizza. Can the hood get good pizza?! Nah it cant
author: Eileen G.

description:
Delivery only. 

Food = hit or miss. Generous portions. 

Buffalo Wings = okay. $6.99.

3-topping Pizza (12" small) with pepperoni, olives, fresh jalapenos = okay. Crust isn't thin but a bit doughy. $17.75.

Mozzarella Cheese Sticks = were they from the local gas station?? Avoid. $7.50.

Green Salad = okay. $6.49

Spaghetti with Meat Sauce = sweet, soggy and odd. $9.99.

Prices = moderate. $52.98.

Service = Delivery arrived on time. 

In a pinch, I'd order the basics again--pizza, wings & salad and skip the rest. Seriously.
author: Fannie S.

description: Awesome pizza place in the outer Richmond area. Stopped by for a couple of specialty slices and waited for about 15 minutes. Got the Virgo and Capricorn slices and they were amazing. I recommend it, if you are looking for pizza in the Richmond area.
author: Lorraine A.

description: While wondering around Golden Gate State Park, we got hungry! This place wasn't too far away, so we decided to swing by for lunch. The wall was entirely uphill (not fun), but the pizza was AWESOME! The crust was nice and crispy and the toppings were delicious! We were the only ones here, so it was nice and quite as we planned the red of the day. Highly recommend.
author: Cassidy R.

description: The joint's sammies are the bezt. Their pizzas have gotten way better in the last 3 years and its one of the most irie spots around. I live a few houses down and still get this over the other local spots without question. Great munchies.
author: Patrick M.

description: Ordered the Leo...yes, pineapple belongs on pizza.  It was perfection.  Thanks Pizza Joint!
author: Kim S.

description:
I've never been to the shop but I've ordered at least 50 times for my family or parties and they have been great. Only a few times have I been a bit disappointed. 

The pizza here is delicious, not too thick or thin but always crunchy. I recommend building your own with a limited amount of toppings, usually I do 2-3 toppings and the pizza is consistent, anything pass that and it can become soggy. The wings are not Buffalo but more like fried with good flavor, make sure to eat all the wings on the first day as reheating the wings in the oven truly dry them out, reheating the pizza in the oven after a day or so in the fridge is still fantastic. 

Overall the delivery has been on time and polite. (Ordered mainly from Eat24)
author: Brian H.

description:
Stopped in to PU a couple slices for the kid.  I ordered 2 slices of cheese pizza and was charged $8.40 or something thereabouts.  I asked the cashier, "is that my bill?" as I looked at the register.  Indeed it was.  I was shocked!  So shocked that I said, "In NYC you can get a slice of pepperoni for $2.50."  He apologized, but it wasn't his fault.  
When I got the pizza home I opened the box and saw some crappy looking pizza.  My husband tasted it and said, "$8.00 for this?!?!"  He equated the cheese on the pizza to Dominos and said it was definitely some shitty bulk cheese.  He said it used to be pretty decent, but now wouldn't touch it.
author: Heather S.

description:
This was the worst pizza we've ever seen. By accident, we ordered a small, but didn't realize this because a small was $30. Yes, you read that correctly. 

On top of that, there was hardly any sauce, cheese or toppings. We promptly asked to send it back and the restaurant had the audacity to ask Eat24 if we could bring it back ourselves after having it set for delivery.

We paid for the poppers that were delivered since we ate them, but those were hardly cooked and seemed partially frozen. 

Don't do it.
author: Colleen M.

description: Mediocre slice of Hawaiian pizza for inflated price $5.25 during outside lands weekend. Yeah not coming back.
author: Jude N.

description:
I would say this is probably the best pizza I've had in the city. I normally get the all meat pizza (cancer) and sometimes add pesto to it. It's pretty good and filling. Also, the crust is a little thick, and nice and crisp. When you chew on it, it's still soft and not hard like other places. But like all pizza, it can get a little pricey sometimes when you include other add ons. 

Also going for the three topping pizza is a good deal :)

They deliver super fast. So if you are counting on that "full hour," order it later. This is definitely the place you want to hit up when you are starving and want good pizza fast.
author: Cristian R.

description: Great pizza! Ordered a medium mushroom pizza for take out & was pleasantly surprised with the quality & taste of the dough, sauce & cheese. The crust is soft & chewy with good flavor, perfectly cooked, the sauce is tasty, not sweet & they don't skimp on the cheese. Def coming back!
author: Cec D.

description: Just driving around getting lost in San Francisco and we found this little gem. The selection is awesome. We had the meatball sandwich. The portion was perfect to share between my daughter and I. The taste was delicious. The service was friendly and great. If we lived here it would be a regular place of ours. Thank you!
author: Tara A.

description: The pizza overall was excellent it was not to crispy but not too soft. The salads were not to be surpassed. The garlic bread was also amazing. The best part of the food was the garlic fries. The restaurant itself has a very mellow mood.
author: Amish S.

description:
The city has great pizza joints. Ya cool bro you've tried pizza delfina and golden boy but I bet said bro has been living in sf for less than 2 years.

Ask a local and they will instantly refer you to Pizzetta 211, Gaspares, or Village pizza. Pizza joint can be added as a great casual or late night spot!

Pizza joint is a marijuana enthusiasts paradise. Sandwiches, by the slice pizza, and a wall lined with candy. Who wants more? Their crust is super buttery and crispy, toppings are rich and plentiful, and they are $4 a piece. 

This was my savior after outside lands. Thanks pizza joint!
author: Peter T.

description: I ordered two sandwiches the pastrami and juicy Lucy. Both had to be thrown away after the first bite. Honestly saying they were disgusting. I was sober and my friend was pretty intoxicated and hungry and still could not eat them. Steer clear of this place.
author: Julianne O.

description: Our order arrived in 45 minutes, that was a plus.  Food was good & reasonably priced.  Calzone could've been cooked a bit longer but it was still tasty.  My son loved the pizza.  Mozzarella sticks were just ok, more like what I could buy at the grocery store.  Even so I'd try this restaurant again.
author: Amy W.

description: Not very good pizza IMO.  The crust is tasteless, and the sauce is not much there but not very good for what is there (to me the sauce makes or breaks the pizza).  There was too much thick tasteless cheese.  I wanted to like this pizza since its close to me but need to keep looking.  It's a cute place though, and friendly people.
author: Dora V.

description: Surprisingly good pizza. Crust was brown on the edges with just the right crunch (I hate soggy dough). Well balanced ingredients.
author: C C.

description: This review is way past due. I visited the pizza joint a couple months back and was really impressed with the great service from all the employees but the owner was a very nice man and have great customer service. I ordered my favorite cheese pizza with pineapple and it was delicious!
author: Melissa J.

description: I've walked by this place so many times and have always been curious about how their pizza stacks up. It was pouring last week so we finally decided to try it and order takeout. The pizza came pretty quick! Overall it was pretty good for delivery pizza. The crust was really good, decent amount of toppings. The cheese was much more  gooey than I normally like, and the cheese wasn't crispy. It probably could have used a few more minutes in the oven. You could also see some liquid (oil?) on the surface but I just wiped it with a nApkin. The pizza was more wet than I normally like but it wasn't bad for a rainy day! Maybe we will order again.
author: Larissa S.

description:
The pizza was okay not to work the money I give them to stop because they wasn't time but this service on the phone was bad attitude we bought large pizza onion and mushroom with one Sprite was cost $35
Include delivery.
author: Daniel S.

description:
I love being able to order pizza by the slice for delivery! Why?! Because I love variety! Committing to one whole pizza by myself is always a lot since I get sick of flavors quickly. Luckily for me, Pizza Joint delivers slices! I ordered via Eat24 since I had a $2 off coupon code.

*Slice of Cheese pizza ($3.50), add Grilled chicken (+$0.50), Mushrooms (+$0.50), Pesto (+$0.50), no red sauce
One of my favorite slices. The pesto had great flavor.

*Slice of Cheese pizza ($3.50), add Baby clams ($0.50), Fresh garlic ($0.50)
This was good because of the garlic. The clams really are small, so you don't get the same texture and flavor as with normal sized clams.

*Slice of Cheese pizza ($3.50), add Fresh basil ($0.50)
Don't add basil. This was definitely a waste of $0.50. There was barely any basil on the slice.

*Slice of Pepperoni pizza ($4), add Sausage ($0.50), Mushrooms ($0.50)
I typically love meat pizzas with mushrooms. But this wasn't very good. The meats didn't have much flavor.

The crust here is thick, so be prepared. I didn't care for the thickness since I prefer thinner crust pizzas. I threw away about 1/3 of the whole crust per slice because it was so bready!

Delivery was quick, but I live two blocks down, so that was expected. There is a $20 minimum which is why I ended up with four slices instead of three. In the end, this satisfied my pizza craving, but I've had better. I may order from them again if I want slices and I don't want to wait. Or maybe I'll forgo the $20 min and walk my lazy butt there!
author: Elena N.

description:
My Boyfriend has been coming here since he went to High School down the street & inteoduced me to it when we first met. It is AMAZING. The pizza, the sandwiches, the appetizers, the deserts. Everything is bomb! 

I get a cookie warmed up every time I come here & they treat you like family. Soon as we walk in they put it in the microwave cuz they remember! I love places like that. 

You gotta Try the Capricorn w/ Jalapeños !! 

& This place puts Bacon on their pizza, & when I say bacon I mean FULL ON STRIPS of bacon.. not bacon crumbs or small pieces. 

The sandwiches are also hella good. I've tried just about every sandwich on the menu and they're all incredible, whatever you're in the mood for. 


Definitely worth trying if you're looking for a new spot that does it all!
author: Lauren W.

description:
Pizza joint is simple, cheap, and delicious. 

I have tried getting food there and getting delivery, and both experiences were pretty good. 

They have very nice pizza and several options of toppings that are just delicious. I did wish they would put a bigger amount of toppings on the pizza, but I guess, to keep the price competitive, they cannot give you a pizza overflowing with the toppings you pick. 

I have tried their pizza, calzones, garlic bread, cheese bread... But, surprisingly, the big star for my husband and I was the lasagna. Very yummy indeed! 

I will come back here whenever I have a craving for good pizza or for cheap yummy lasagna.
author: Andréia S.

description: I always get the pepperoni pizza, I like the crust is a bit crispy and the cheese tastes so good. I can't say how the other toppings or foods are, I'm a creature of habit but they've been consistently good for the 4 yrs I've been eating here.
author: Ellie R.

description: The Pizza was incredible! Much better than I expected. Ordered from Eat24 and the pizza arrived earlier than expected. Ordered an XL Pizza with pepperoni and sausage as well as some garlic bread with cheese. The garlic bread was nothing special. Looked like sandwich bread with butter and a little cheese on it. However the pizza was incredible! The crust was thin and crispy and there was plenty of cheese and toppings. This is going to be my goto pizza place in the sunset!
author: John W.

description: This spot on Balboa is great don't-care-who-sees me pizza. They have a selection of pizzas named for each zodiac sign (Libra has the best flavor balance) which is pretty entertaining. If you order for delivery do it through yelp - I never could get their dedicated website to work correctly and now that I no longer have to shout my order via phone over the din of a noisy kitchen I just won't go back to calling.
author: Diana R.

description: I love this neighborhood pizza!!! The crust is to die for and the staff and service are great!! What else could a pizza lover ask for? Did I mention that the crust is amazing?? Try it for yourself!
author: Raquel S.

description: I love their Pizza it's the best pizza in town.  Good service. Great owner, and good employees. I highly recommend this place.
author: Fadi R.

description: I tried pizza joint for the first time this past Monday. I've honestly never noticed it before o
author: Mercedes K.

description: I live nearby so this is my go to pizza spot when hosting a game or having a game night with friends. It's nothing to rave to mom about it's as good as your pizza hut/ dominos. I like that it's locally owned and they sell pizza by the slice. I see a lot of kids visit this spot after school. Definitely good for the kiddos 18 and younger before they learn what real good pizza is. I would order again only if I'm trying to feed lots of people for cheap.
author: Linda L.

description: I really like this place. The menu is extensive with sandwiches bagels pizza salads, they even have candy?! The ambiance is mellow nothing fancy, theres no pressure here. The staff are nice and down to earth-- did I mention the pizza slices are big?! You can add your own toppings for a slice of pizza!!!! Do recommend! Plus theres a pizza named after the entire zodiac. It would be cool if they added real napkins on the tables. still coming back though !
author: RayRay M.

description: Food was amazing, and the owner named Joe was so kind to me and my friends when we were there. I can't wait to go back when I'm in Frisco again! :)
author: LisaMarie M.

description:
One of the few pizza places where I give more than just a shoulder shrug, when it comes to their pies. Good crust, nice folks, fair pricing, and salad is decent.

But the topics are sparse when you build your own - only really worth it if you order a specialty pie. 

Delivery is on point, so always an easy, I'm lazy as all hell, option.
author: Darrell L.

description: Pizza was good as always but it would've been better if the remembered to cut it into slices for us...
author: Tommy T.

description: Good pizza when in the area and need a slice (quickly).  The pizza is doughy and tasty, and not very expensive.  Watch out for Wash High crowds at certain times midweek!  Otherwise, I'll be back sooner or later when the need arises for a quick slice.  They also feature interesting oven-toasted sandwiches, although I have not tried those yet.
author: Andy S.

description: Had a hankering for pizza, and pizza joint look to be a good option. Pizza was good and not as greasy as most.  Delivery time was about average, and liked the crust
author: Rodger R.

description: Went here with a friend after searching high and low for a place with both pizza and bbq wings. The food was ready for pick up super quick and it was delicious! The guy working the counter (possibly the owner) was incredibly nice and personable and joked around with us about our hangovers. He also threw in a free cookie for us! He made the experience more than just a standard pizza pick up and we will definitely be returning. Don't miss out on this place!
author: Bruno C.

description: Helloooooooooooooooo Yelpers Immmmmmmmmmmmmmm Back!!! Just like I have mentioned in my check in of The Pizza Joint!!! And not only that Itsssssssssss been some what about 24 years ago that... I have eaten a slice of pizza at the Pizza Joint since my high school days at George Washington High School!!! The Pizza Joint At 3088 Balboa St has changed a lot accept for the Combination Pizza...  Which is still today and the pizza slices are still big!!! I had myself a Combination Pizza Slice which was about 2 weeks ago!!!
author: William B.

description: This joint has all your late night needs covered: pizza, desert, soft drinks, plus a wall of snacks!  Stopped by on a slow night for a cheese pizza. I think they took it out of the oven too soon because the crust was a little under cooked under the cheese. (This may have been my fault for showing up too early...) The crust on the edges was perfect: light and flaky with a little crunch to it.  This was a decent pizza. Will have to be back to try all the different toppings!
author: Gee W.

description:
Good pepperoni pizza! The only complaint I have is that the crust is a little on the larger size so you miss out on topping real estate. 

The chocolate cake is good, too!
author: Emma M.

description:
Ordered a Cancer Pizza via Eat24 on a Tuesday night. Pretty reasonable prices. I got my pizza and it only had pepperoni, not the other toppings! Pizza Joint gave me a discount and re-delivered the right pizza in like 15 minutes!!! 

Love this kind of customer service. I don't expect perfection. But if an establishment makes a mistake, they go out and fix it. 

Will be ordering again! Best pizza I've had in Outer Richmond.
author: Michael M.

description:
Awesome! Just Awesome! This pizza shop makes the best rolls and sandwiches around! They must have 20-30 sandwiches on the menu hot bread from the oven.

The owner is a super nice guy and the staff are great. Gets really busy at lunch time from the high school next door but any other time all good. 

5 STARS!
author: Mark H.

description:
While staying nearby I wandered into this place one night, looking for some food after 9 pm. Although my first visit was out of desperation, I then came back the following two nights. Basically, I ate here three nights in a row.

This is one of the only places I've found that will make you a slice of pizza fresh. Although the crust is a bit thick for some, I love it. Also, the meatball sub is the best I've ever had. At $4 for a fresh slice of pepperoni and $6 for a meatball sub, the prices are very reasonable for the area.

Finally, the staff is friendly and they are open late. This place was a very pleasant surprise; I will happily come back if I'm in the area.
author: Nathan B.

description: Actually Yelp recommended me to your pizza joint, so glad I took its advise (being an out of towner). Ordered the Gemini and it was yummy and the crust was just as yummy, perfectly baked and the toppings were a great mix. The Caesar salad was good. Delivery for a Friday night was on point. Thanks!
author: Johanna C.

description:
I ate here a couple times while visiting SF, had their pizza sub and a full sized pizza.  Both were super tasty, better than your typical pizza chain.  They weren't listed on Google Maps for some reason, though, I only found them because my bus dropped me off right next to them on my first day in town.  

My only real complaint is that they take so long to make your order.  The sub took about 10 minutes to make, and the pizza took somewhere around twice that long.
author: Jason C.

description: Got a sandwich TO-GO. It really was a bad sandwich. Dry and little taste. But to top it off the cashier yelled thanks as he's helping a customer, in the most sarcastic tone ever. Cause I didn't tip. You did no service. I pay for good service. You handed me food as if it were drive-thru. Service and food... horrible...avoid at all cost
author: Matt B.

description:
I would post a picture of my pizza sub, but I ate the entire thing because it was so amazing. The pizza is great too. 

Tonight was my first time eating here and I had a great experience overall. I was greeted by a friendly guy as I walked in, I looked at the impressive menu and finally settled on a pizza sub. The guy that made it was extremely nice and my food was outstanding, the best toasted sandwich I've had since I moved here from Chicago, 18 months ago. 

The guy that helped me was so nice and I learned that they deliver to my neighborhood and he made sure I had a menu before I left. Great little casual place, nice people, clean, really good food and a solid delivery area. I will absolutely be eating here again.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Ordered a seafood pizza (the fish). It is suppose to have shrimp, clam, and garlic. Big mistake. More like garlic pizza. So not worth $23 for medium. 

Pizza took forever. Looks like you will get your pizza faster if it's for delivery. When we finally got the pizza, we asked for plates. ONE plate and then walked away. Rude much!
author: Jasmin T.

description: My first time trying this place and got the 24 inch pie. The crust was nice and crunchy.  Not bad. The pie was huge! The slice did not fit on the plate.
author: cal t.

description: The pizza was very dry. It looks like they used maybe 1 tbsp of sauce for the entire pizza. It tasted more like cheese bread than pizza but the crust was good. Their sandwiches, on the other hand, are really tasty.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Honestly this place is horrible. The cashier did not even no what offer me. And I am hispanic and he was Hispanic but I could tell he saw me as not a customer. He was not nice at all. Worst thing I saw was. Cross contamination he would touch money and make salads and he never once wash his hands. I also saw the workers in the back eat the cheese from the top of the pizzas that were for delivery. But honestly the worst part was when some white folks came in he was all nice and even gave them discount coupons. From my own people sat, Sept 3 at 7pm. That really sux. God loves each one of us no matter who we are but we must also love our selves. This place is racist and bad. If u guys want cross contamination food nock ur self out
author: Jose C.

description: This is our go to pizza place! Delivery is always on time and the pizza is great. Order online to receive the specials.  Online orders are always done correctly!
author: Jes C.

description: Ok- so it's been a year or so since I last ordered and I had a craving for a Scorpio pizza.  Just got it and there was a little mix up, just wanna thank the super nice delivery guy for how he handled it :)  this review is for him.  Thanks dude .  Although I didn't get exactly what I ordered, my pizza was still very enjoyable and delivery took less than the estimated time
author: Angela K.

description: Best pizza I ever had.especialy the cancer all meat they also got manny deferent bagels
author: Diego D.

description:
Pizza Joint is my delivery Pizza by excellence!
I am a fan of thick fluffy pizza and thats what you get at Pizza Joint! The crust is buttery and fluffy.
I always go for a whole pizza and they usually have coupons for delivery.
I love to grab a sandwich on the go for a picnic in the park, or even a slice of pizza.
Everyone is super nice and friendly which is always a big plus.
author: Marï Ä.

description: Worst pizza "joint" ever.  They're probably smoking doobies while they take orders judging by their timeliness.  3 hours later, no pizza.  Where the hell is it?  It's coming, says pizza [smoking a] joint.  One star.  Go elsewhere for your piz
author: Eric H.

description: Amazing pizza & wonderful, crispy wings. We ordered a standard pepperoni pizza with thin crust. The cheese was plentiful, the sauce just right and the crust amazing. My only regret is that we didn't discover this place earlier in our visit to San Francisco. It'll be on our itinerary next time we're in town.
author: Laura W.

description: Horrible customer service. Eat somewhere else. They don't care about their customers. We came on a windy and cold evening and asked them to close the door since my kids were getting so cold but refused to without any explanation why. Another family came in & asked to close the door since everyone was getting cold but again, they just said it's their policy to leave the door open. Seriously, your customers are eating at your (crappy) pizza joint so uncomfortably. Pizza was too greasy!
author: MJ H.

description:
Delicious!!! The customer service was great: they forgot part of our order and by the time I had realized it and called about it, they'd already realized their mistake and sent a delivery driver with the missing items.

Pizza is sacred to two kids from New York, so to say that we will order from here again is the real deal!
author: Daphne W.

description:
This is simply the best cafe in the vicinity; not pretentious, with a good selection of sandwiches  -- excellent crust, and sauce on the Pizza, unlike some of the more fufu places that allow those who spend a lot imagine they are getting something higher -- when it's just the bill and some fancy garnishment/small size.    I also loved their meatball sandwich.  Actually, I can't think  of a better Pizza place in the city at their price range -- and I have been to many, but I guess it depends on what kind of crust you like (I'm not into thins soggy crust anymore-- while here it is just right -- easy to sink teeth into, light and fluffy).  Pretty much need to go the East Bay and Zachary's to beat this.

No experience with their delivery (so cant' comment on that), but cute little place to dine in.  Support your local Pizza joint, give it a try, if you live in the hood, no doubt you will return.
author: Gibo M.

description: Great menu, great selection, unique pizzas and sandwiches, super friendly and accommodating staff. This is THE pizza place in the Richmond FAT slices, perfectly cooked these guys got it going on
author: Zach W.

description: Super yummy. The crust is especially awesome. Toppings are good quality. Never had any delivery issues or order inaccuracies.
author: S L.

description: Solid neighborhood pies. Crust is above average and so is the cheese. Red sauce isn't too sweet which is nice. People are friendly in the way you'd expect from a neighborhood corner joint. Impressively broad pizza & sandwich menu. It's not the best out there, but good value for the price.
author: David L.

description: Consistently tasty pizza & sami's!  Usually takes 30min for takeout. The guys are real nice but get confused when you give them your name for take out. They know you by the pie you ordered. "Capricorn & garlic cheese bread" that's me. They used to give you a call when your order was ready so you could pop over if you live nearby. I miss that little friendly touch. But they seem busy so that makes me happy! Also the teens from the school nearby make lunchtime hop, so be prepared if you want a lunch slice.
author: Kalie J.

description: We moved here from OKC, OK, where you can get surprisingly good pizzas from local owners at a great price. We moved to SF nine months ago and have tried pizza 2 or 3 times from different places that tasted just 'so so' but were very expensive.  We have ordered from Pizza Joint twice (delivery) and both times it was excellent and reasonably priced.  Our fav is the Aquarius but the pizzas  with red sauce were also great.  The salad and chocolate cake was also good.  We will continue to order from them.
author: Debra B.

description: I used to live very close to Pizza Joint. They guys working there are friendly and nice to talk with. Their pizzas are very good and they have the 'combo' size for pizza that it HUGE! Definitely a great local place!
author: Romain D.

description:
This restaurant has yet to mess up an order.  They don't skimp on toppings, and the delivery is lightning fast. Once, a year ago or so, their delivery person had car troubles, so the owner/manager called me and gave me free pizza another day. I would have given another star, but I think the crust is a bit lacking. It's too airy for me.  

Overall - Good pizza, good customer service. Satisfied customer
author: Katherine S.

description: This is my favorite pizza in the Richmond. I order here all the time and they're always quick and always delicious. The guys are super friendly and always seem happy which is so rarely the case.
author: Justin D.

description: The people who run this place and very friendly- I've always gotten great costumer service. Their sandwiches are my favorite and they're the best place to order pizza from. I love Wash House- have been a regular costumer here since 2008!
author: Argishti P.

description: Not the best pizza in SF, but definitely not the worst. Fast, convenient, and the people that work there are super nice!
author: Brock H.

description: I do not recommend this place due to the long wait times and poor communication and customer service skills. I ordered online through the Eat24 app and the wait was so long that I had the Eat24 folks contact the restaurant about my order. The Eat24 person who I messaged then messaged me and said that my order was out for delivery according to the restaurant. After waiting for 25 minutes more I then called the restaurant myself and asked on the status of my order and male person advised me that my order was out for delivery. I went ahead and told the person ok. About 10 minutes later my family had to leave for work and weren't able to eat and would now have to grab food on the way to work. So again I had to call the restaurant and cancel my order due to the longer then average wait times. After canceling my order about 5 minutes later the delivery man called and said he was outside and I told him to contact the restaurant because I had canceled the order. He made up in excuse about my address being different on paper. I've always ordered using the Eat24 app and have never had a problem with delivery in the past.
author: Sailiuta S.

description: amazing sandwiches. They delivered quite fast and the sandwiches were still very warm and so crunchy. The price is so low compared to how big the sandwiches are, we couldn't even finish them. We will definitely order from here again very soon.
author: Lidia M.

description: This is my new go to place for pizza.  First time ordering they got the order wrong.. didn't deliver the extra toppings or sauces. I called, and they sent out a new pizza right away.  Delivery guy was fast and friendly and the pizza and salads were really good.  5 stars for the food and 5 stars for the great service.
author: Jeff S.

description: We went there on a Thursday afternoon after a Segway ride (yeah, I know...). It's a small place, but the pizzas are great: big, really good, and at a decent price. The owner was very friendly and offered us cookies while we were waiting for our order to be ready. I'll definitely get back there next time I'm in this part of town. They have decent vegetarian options too, and have a lot of sandwiches (with cool names) for those who don't feel like eating pizzas.
author: Sebastien C.

description: I love coming here. Good food and friendly service. The owner is always nice. They are actually open earlier  on the weekdays 7 am  to 10 pm
author: Donna S.

description: Overall the pizza taste I'd give it 3 stars. But along with the service.... 2 stars overall experience. When we first walked in, the cashier who told us later that he was the owner's son, didn't greet us. I said hi to him first. Anyway, we also asked him a few questions about the menu. Meatball sandwiches are not served with homemade meatballs sadly. So we ordered a pizza instead. We sat down, tables were sticky so I went to get some napkins and told the cashier that the tables were sticky. He stood there and stared at me so I said "i have some napkins can you wet them so I can wipe down the table...it's sticky" and he's like "oh you want me to wet them?" And I said "well do you have a rag to wipe it down?" And he's said "oh yeah." It's like okay...not rocket science but I went back to the table and he came over to wipe it down. He also didnt restock anything in the front...we saw him standing there the whole time. We needed knives and he handed one to me but said "theyre usually in the container with the forks." But he didn't restock them after I walked away. waited about 25-30 for our pizza to arrive to the table. This is more of a take out spot even though they have tables to sit down at. Drinks were bottled only, no cups with ice, plastic ware only, sat down with the pizza box and paper plates in front of us. The pizza was rather doughy, leaving the crust very thick. The ground beef looked more like sausage. They left a bottle of ranch on the table for us to help ourselves and when we left we asked for a sauce container for the .50 ranch we paid for and the cashier gave us a container and we had to ask him again for a lid..... probably not coming back anytime soon or again..disappointing experience!
author: Jane S.

description: Pricey for standard pizza, delivery time average. Everything tasted good though.
author: Elise L.

description: Loved the Pisces pizza, also lived the turkey sandwich came in like 30 mins. So glad I tried this spot out workers are friendly.
author: Chris R.

description:
The BF and I just HAD to get pizza since it was National Pizza Day (February 9). Look it up, it's Wikipedia official! Anywho, wanted to grab something close to our hood, but didn't want a full pie, so we found Pizza Joint! They sell by the slice, but little did we know that EACH slice was probably equivalent to the size of a personal pizza. SLICES BIGGER THAN MY FACE. Seriously. 

Tasty pizza, but downside was we didn't realize that 4 slices would cost us more than a small pizza! $18 something for 4 slices. Now, that may sound ridiculous, but honestly because of the size and the fact that we didn't just get plain cheese slices, I felt that it was worth it. I couldn't even finish my slices. They didn't have the thin crust style kind of crust--more of the thick crust, bready, yet still crunchy kind. I personally liked it and would go back, but maybe just for 1 slice at a time. Haha. The guys behind the counter were nice and the decor of the place was cute. They have sandwiches too! The names of the pizzas and the sandwiches are fun as well. One sandwich that stood out to me was one with spam and bacon, omgz. Have to try one of these days. Hahaha. 

Until the next National Pizza Day, Pizza Joint! or maybe sooner! More than likely sooner. :]
author: Mariel A.

description:
Wow - where do I start.

"Pizza is like sex, when it's good - it's good, when it's bad - it's still pretty good".

Well, Pizza Joint is like the best sex you've ever had - You finished it in 5 minutes, you're overly satisfied as you clean up,  and you still have change in your wallet.

In all seriousness this is the best pizza I have had in a long time......... and I've recently been on a tour of some of the best pizza to devour in New York.

Cheese to sauce ratio (CSR) - perfect
Crust/ dough - crispy base, light and fluffy on the inside. Medium thickness.

Delivery was very prompt - ordered at 7:30pm on a Friday night.

Delivery boy/ phone man were both very friendly. Prices are reasonable (but as long as it is good who actually cares how much it cost). Right?

I thoroughly recommend you try this place.

Devastated to have found it on my last night spent in San Francisco.
author: Jason H.

description: I like their pizza and it is reasonably priced. It is convenient for me as I'm in the outer Richmond.
author: Jay H.

description:
I ordered the cancer pizza and the chicken caesar salad. 

Cancer pizza was good. The bread was tasty. 

Chicken caesar sald was not so good. It was drenched in dressing and the chicken tasted like sweet teriyaki chicken. Blah! After a few bites, I was done and threw it out in the trash. Thank god it was only $5 and some change. 

Delivery took a little over an hour. Not bad, especially for a weekend.
author: Annette F.

description: We had resumed ordering from here for a little while because they're usually fast and not horrible. We always got half virgo and half cancer. The last time I called to place this order, the kid on the phone told me that they had to charge me an extra $5 for ordering half of one and half of another. I asked to talk to a manager and he said that no one was available. He just kept repeating that that's what he was told to tell me. What a ridiculous policy and horrible customer service! I will never order from here again.
author: Amy B.

description:
Amazing place.

I come here weekly and the owners are super friendly. Their pizzas are super crusty and nice.
author: Jens V.

description: Ordered delivery and arrived a little earlier than estimated. Food was delicious. Kids love the cheese pizza and the Aquarius is to die for...if you love pesto and garlic. Highly recommend this place.
author: Anna J.

description: Rude over the phone and too expensive. Beware of ordering half and half for toppings because they count a half as whole and will charge for that ex. if you order half mushroom half pepperoni it counts as two toppings. If you get past 4 toppings on a jumbo they will double the price on the 5th topping since it's not advertised or printed in their menu. The pizza itself rivals a domino's pizza on a bad day. Very thick crust and not much flavor unless grease counts on your flavor pallet.
author: Andrew P.

description: Incredibly large, thick, cheesy, and satisfying single slices available. One slice can easily function as an entire meal! Nice staff, too.
author: Shendi X.

description: No complaints. Great pizza. Not too greasy, tasty crust, quick quality food. I had a pepperoni mushroom fresh jalapeño.
author: Nixie G.

description: It's my go-to spot everyday after school. There are lots of consistent, well- priced food items and the atmosphere is like home.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Review from my 7 year old daughter:
I went to pizza joint  and ate a slice of cheese pizza. I really liked it .For the first time it was a good cheese slice . Cheese pizza is my favorite kind of pizza and it was really  good .
author: Lacrimosa L.

description: Oye. If you are looking for a cheaper option for pizza while at Hardly Strictly or Outside Lands, just go for the huge slices at I 'heart' spicy pie. it's bigger, it's better, and unlike Pizza Joint, it won't make you sick. This place cannot possibly be in business this long only selling pizza, right? is there some kind of secret menu we're all missing?
author: Mike V.

description:
This place is just okay for me. I went here a few times because I lived about a block away. It takes them quite a while to make one sandwich & their pizzas are quite expensive for the quality.

If you must go here, I suggest a sandwich over a pizza. They're average, but pretty cheap!
author: Junel S.

description: Terrific food! Good service and friendly staff. Pizzas are always hot, ready, and fresh. The sandwiches and bagels are delicately and professionally made.
author: John L.

description:
First of all, I only ordered from this place only once (sadly there won't be second time) so it might just be my unlucky day. And second, I have always prefer Italian style pizza so this is just my personal taste. 

I ordered pesto broccoli pizza with mushroom and I was disappointed. ( And yes, you may make fun of my love for broccoli pizza) The pie was a decent size but it has less topping than other places I usually order from. The dough was undercooked and tasted a bit gross. The topping was overcooked and soggy. The pesto sauce reminded me of store-bought jar pesto, which is bland and doesn't taste very fresh. The whole thing is so greasy I couldn't finish one slice. Overall it was very disgusting. 

Since it has such high rating I can only guess it was my unlucky day. But seriously, YUCK.
author: Bobo V.

description: Fast and great!  We've ordered twice  in the past week and it's been consistent :)
author: Angie L.

description:
MMMMMM. Good Pizza! The slices here are good and affordable.
Came here all the time during High School haha man I love these guys good old memories. Good and big sandwiches as well! Good assortment of drinks as well.


Wash House!
author: Anonymous ?.

description: I actually have grown to really love Pizza Joint, especially their crust! It is even better the next day as leftovers. This is definitely our go-to pizza spot in the Richmond. The crust keeps us coming back for more! Yum yum
author: Kelly S.

description:
salad of the gods. 
chicken caesar salad is hands down the most perfect salad in the entire city. 
it's 5 simple ingredients. it's $5.50. it's an entire head of romaine, crisp, clean, evenly distributed leafy greens & crunchy whites. it's homemade croutons. it's tender, succulent, dark meat roast chicken. and then it's the perfect ample dosage of light, creamy, salty, cheesy caesar dressing. 
i would eat this everyday. big love. big big love. this salad is inspired. don't miss their tremendous pizzas as well!! pizza joint is a neighborhood gem that dependably delivers!!
author: Libra J.

description:
We ordered delivery from them last night and the first thing we noted upon looking at the online menu is the awesome pizzas named after astrology signs. Okay, sure, it's silly, but come on, it's pretty awesome. We kept it simple and ordered our signs:

- Pisces: Shrimp, Clams, and Fresh Garlic
- Sagittarius: Spicy Red Sauce, Tomatoes, Barbecue Chicken, Fresh Cilantro, and Fresh Jalapenos
- Jalapeno Poppers
- Buffalo Wings

Everything was delicious and the pizzas were spot on. I loved the spiciness of the Sagittarius and the Pisces was a great blend of seafood. The appetizers were also perfectly prepared and arrived in good condition (crisp and tasty in their fried glory).
author: Shauna S.

description: We love this place, and their pizza. However, I just put in our order for two half specials, something we have been ordering for months, and was told that ordering two half specials now includes an extra charge of $5.00.  I am so shocked that I changed my mind and hung up the phone. They should build this into the price, not penalize choices.  Don't know how to rate now. Sorry guys. I hope that is a new employee making stuff up. If so, please let us know. We are regular customers and love your pizza. - DNB
author: Debra N.

description:
Essentially ordered two very different pizzas for 2 different camps of people. A hawaiian type and a meat lovers type, to satisfy all. When I opened the boxes, we couldn't figure out which was what. One had pepperoni, pineapple and red onions. The other one had ham ( not canadian bacon as stated in the description), italian sausage and cilantro(?), no mushrooms or bell pepper, which was supposed to be in the "meat-type" pizza. It was totally disappointing, especially with the total over $50 ( we had poppers & wings as well) for the stars of the show to be clusterfucked like that. The taste was alright,according to the others, but nowhere near what we wanted. All I tasted was disappointment. I won't order here again.  

Let's just call it Joint, somebody in the kitchen was smoking it.
author: Priscilla M.

description: My order was supposed to take 45-60 minutes but arrived after 95 minutes. The wings are cold and the pizza is cold and soggy, so they're now going in the trash and we're going out to eat instead. Never ordering from here again.
author: Raymond S.

description: We tried to get delivery twice. First time--they had no Coke, and "substituded" Sprite at our door. Second time, they had no cranberry sauce. Given that a sandwich we ordered is expensive and they didn't tell us that they had no cranberry sauce until we called after our food was delivered, this was annoying. They demanded that we give back all food to get a return for our money. Do not order from here--I hope they don't give food back. Why else would they demand so from a customer? It was very awkward asking the delivery person what he was going to do with the food.
author: April M.

description: I went down to California for the day today and me and my friends recorded to stop here. The food was absolutaly amazing and the people who worked there were so friendly. I will definitely be stopping by here ever time in in San Francisco!
author: Cassy R.

description: The pizza here is really good and the owner was the sweetest! He went above a beyond to make sure our food was good and even gave us free nachos during a giants World Series game!
author: Erin S.

description: Favorite pizza in town by the slice! Always get pepperoni and jalapeño and it's always delicious. Love all the guys who work there, always super friendly. My friend and I go a decent amount and they hooked us up with a free slice each tonight! Highly recommend if in Bay Area.
author: Nico E.

description:
Ordered delivery to my work. Was craving spaghetti so I was glad they were able to deliver with a small minimum order charge ($12). But the spaghetti was really mushy, their meatballs are sliced in half. I've had better. Their choco cake was good, but for $3.50 I would have appreciated either a bigger slice or better quality. It seemed like one of those frozen, sara lee pies. 
One star for ordering online convenience and delivery person seemed pleasant enough. 
Just for location convenience, I would go order here again to try their pizza.
author: Christine Y.

description:
This is an excellent place to order from if you want to wait for over an hour for your pizza.  You should probably plan on calling up to 90 minutes before you want your pizza just to give them time to pretend the pizza's on their way while they furiously make the pizza they totally forgot to make earlier.  Also, they often don't respond to phone calls when you ask them where your pizza is

(note- this has happened than more than once)
author: Jon S.

description: We used to live a few blocks away & this was our go-to place. We moved across the park to the Outer Sunset about a year ago, and just can't find pizza we like. So, tonight after a horrific experience with another company, we ordered delivery. In person the staff is great, on the phone they were good, and the delivery guy (who we recognized) was good too. Pizza is always delicious- nice crunchy crust, generous on the toppings. The delivery didn't disappoint- but wasn't piping hot as it is just out of the oven. Given the drive to our area, I'm thoroughly satisfied. We will continue to patronize this business, despite now being across the park.
author: Reva B.

description: Came here for the first time and I do gotta say the pizza sub was really delicious love the food here and the cook is very fast and professional and the guys there are really nice and plan to come here more often people really need to check this joint out it's bomb good
author: Jeffrey D.

description: These guys deliver my pizza to the wrong address. .wtf!! Seems like they don't listen to well over the phone.  Waited over 1 hour and I had to call them 3 times..make sure they repeat the address and order!
author: Jason L.

description: The best pizza crust ever. Fast delivery.  Aquarius and Sagittarius are just delicious.
author: Li C.

description: So my family and I have tried 4 different pizza places before settling on Pizza Joint as our favorite. The workers are extremely friendly and super nice to kids. The channel choice on the tv could be a little more tasteful for a family dining in. And I don't know about you but I like to dip my pizza in ranch and to me ranch sitting out on the counter all day is not sanitary. So my recommendation is to order your delicious pizza and have it delivered or pick it up.
author: Victoria Y.

description: wow. this place is amazing. I just moved in down the street and started walking and stumbled upon this place. the smell lured me in. got the classics slice of pepperoni and a fountain coca cola. $5.15!! total!! Delish! Both of them!!! the piece of pizza was huge! and everything I wanted it to taste like and MORE!!! service was excellent!!! great guy behind the counter!
author: Beverly B.

description:
This place has such a variety of food and the prices are pretty cheap because it's located right next to a high school.  

The quality is average, but the staff is friendly.  I would recommend ordering delivery rather than dining in.
author: Jessyca M.

description:
Okay, the pizza here is really not that great. You could tell me it's Digornio and I wouldn't second-guess that. This place is so much more than a pizza joint though. They offer a wide selection at their deli-style counter, including chicken teriyaki, macaroni salad, fruit cups, and treats. They are so nice here too, I think the owner was in when I came by and he was really friendly and sweet. They also are a little mini-mart with a wall full up of their candy selection. This definitely is a neighborhood pit stop, and for good reason!

A nice spot to come hang out alone or with a group
author: Nicole B.

description:
I really wanted to order by phone and have it delivered to my house but I misplaced the menu so I had to go to the restaurant.  You can make your own pizza (they charge per topping) or order their combo pizzas named after the horoscope.

I don't have the menu in front of me but I got what is akin to a supreme pizza and pesto chicken. They really put a lot of toppings on the supreme pizza (the sausage was a bit too big for my taste but it was yummy) and chicken pesto.  I'm more of a chicken pizza fan so I really liked that one.  DH loved the supreme one as well.

Pizza was still piping hot when we got home and very good.  A good option to consider for take out!
author: Wendy H.

description: Good pizza, nice selection of other food, clean layout with an easily visible tv, very friendly & courteous staff.
author: Dustin B.

description: Our family goes here all the time, because we love their pizza. We keep it simple--cheese pizzas with olives and vegetarian pizzas, plus a salad or two. The crust is incredible, a meal in and of itself with a salad. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. Simple restaurant interior, but yummy pizza keeps us coming back again and again!
author: Megan B.

description: The pizza here is not bad! We ordered the special which was 2 medium 2 topping pizzas for $18. We got one with ham and sausage and the other one was with pepperoni and salami. We will try the other pizza choices next time for sure.
author: Jennie W.

description:
I've ordered from here a few times now and while it's no Pizzetta 211 it is decent. It's just a block away so when I'm feeling the need for a little no frill pizza and too lazy to walk somewhere Pizza Joint comes the rescue. 

Delivery is free and in the event I feel like taking a short walk it's very close and conveniently located to me.
author: Leanne S.

description:
I honestly have no idea if their food is good or not, because when I ordered delivery tonight the food never came.

The story is long and boring, but the upshot is that I waited for about two hours, and even called to check on my order. They confirmed that they'd received it, and it was on its way. Three hours later, the restaurant had been closed, and my food had never arrived. Luckily I'd ordered through Eat24, and they gave me a full refund, but man, that sucks.
author: Alex P.

description:
I will admit that I will add a star because this place is so convenient to my house, which added to the already good quality of food they provide is an automatic 4 stars for me. I can only comment on slices and sandwiches, and therefore will update when I order a specialty pizza in the future.

Sandwiches - $3.50 + $0.50 (cheese) is a great deal on some decent quality sandwiches. 

Pizza - Crust is crispy and doughy making it a unique flavor around the area. Quality ingredients top off this great crust making a tasty pizza. 

Pizza Joint is located right next to a high school so it helps that it caters to their needs and budget, and thus benefits those who are not in high school. This helps create other menus that other pizzerias don't provide such as nachos, popcorn chicken, or spam musubi if you want a little variety with your meal.

My only gripe is that the combination pizza although packed with toppings is smaller in comparison to other slices.
author: Casey L.

description: Called to order a pizza delivery. Very rude on the phone, snapped they charge 5 dollars more for a half and half pizza when I requested this. Doesn't understand the term 'side order' when I enquired what side orders do they have, barking 'what do you mean side order'. Had food from there before, average pizzas at best, won't be going to them again any time ever. Plenty of other, better pizza joints around to choose from
author: Mark D.

description:
$3.50 for A REAL SANDWICH!
Why?
Because there is a high school is right behind.
So, 5 bucks including drinks.
 
The sandwich is REALL GOOD.
$4 if you want cheese.
INCLUDING TAX!!!!
So, I must say that it is $8 sandwich is $4.

But you have to get there before the high school kids get there.
Human centipedes again!
Smell sweat of period of rapid growth.
FXXX!
I was there at i think it was 11:20 am.
The guys are crazy working there, making many Pizzas and things for lunch menu.
I ordered a turkey sandwich.
The sandwich takes a bit because they do oven toast.
Nice and crunchy!
The bun is awesome.
It's a killer sandwich!

So, while I was waiting, I saw kids coming in little by little, but soon later it became a long line like human caterpillars.

I didn't want to be a part of the line.
But, at the same time, I was thinking,
What a lucky high school kids they are!

My boys didn't go the high school.
The school they went, they got nothing.
Nothing like this place near there.
I took them to their high school almost every day.
FXXX!
I wish they went the high school right behind the Pizza Joint.

I can't wait for "off school season".
Are they open for "off school season" ?
I hope so.
But I just wondering how the place make the business going with out the high school kids?

People, listen!
Support The Pizza Joint especially off school season!

Human centipedes free season.

Urrrrr, sorry, forgot to mention, the pizza is good too by the way.
Spam Musubi too for Asian Kids!
author: Nobu K.

description: I've  ordered from the Pizza Joint since I moved into the neighborhood three years ago. The pizza is really good; my friends and I ordered an XXL and we ate the whole thing. When I've asked for delivery they have been prompt and the pizza hot. They are my go-to pizza spot.
author: Matt C.

description: Great service and great prices. Don't order from the other Pizza Joints in town. They are awful
author: Chet H.

description: Pizza here is actually really good!!  The sandwiches... not so sure though lol.  I have been ordering from this establishment for a while and I'm too lazy to walk up the hill to pick it up they always deliver within 20-30 minutes to my place.  Besides it being convenient, their pizza is quite tasty.  I've ordered the Pisces and I found it to be quite tasty and simple.  It's also not loaded with nearly as much grease as other places I've ordered from.  Not sure if I got lucky, but the many times I've ordered grease was a much lower factor... unless it sunk into the pizza.. and that's ok LOL.  Still tasty.  =)
author: John H.

description:
I honestly want to give this place a better rating because the food is actually pretty good, which is why I've had a few weird experiences with them but have continued to go back. After tonight though, I think I've been pushed over the edge and will never order from them again. Their treatment of customers, even frequent customers like myself (I live right around the corner), is strange and pretty rude that I don't want to give them my business at all. 

1) They have an extensive sandwich menu written on the wall that extends across half of one side of the place. Nowhere on this menu or anywhere in the entire place does it say that sandwiches are only served during certain hours (which I don't think is actually the case?). But walking in the other night excited for a Pizza Joint sub, I was met with two employees with their backs turned from the door doing nothing except chatting. They didn't even greet me and my boyfriend. But as our eyes turned to the ENORMOUS portion of their menu listing the sandwiches, they immediately said "No sandwiches. All the stuff is put away." This was at 9pm and they close at 10pm... Like I understand that it's *almost* closing time, but an hour before? Give me a break. Why should more than half their menu already be put away? It was very weird and their hostile attitude was annoying. If that's how it is every night as well, they should clarify that on the menu...

2) On their website, they advertise 2 medium 2 topping pizzas for $18. They have an extensive topping selection which is a huge part of their appeal for me. But a lot of the topping are labeled with as asterisk (*) and explained as being priced as 2 toppings instead of 1. A lot of their stuff is labeled as such, and I get why so it usually doesn't bother me. But thinking that I could order one of the toppings priced as 2 and another and just pay extra, I called to do so. Nowhere on the coupon does it explain that this can't be done and that there are "no exceptions." If the rules of using this coupon were explained in fine print, I wouldn't complain. But the guy told me he "literally couldn't do that" when I asked to get both pineapple and shrimp on my pizza because shrimp counts as 2 toppings on their menu. I told him I was willing to pay whatever extra charge because that's the pizza I wanted. But no he "just couldn't do that." So they lost out on business from me because they couldn't charge me extra? Very weird, and I didn't appreciate the way he talked to me especially since technically the pizza DID have only 2 toppings on it, and I was very willing to pay an extra charge.

They won't be getting my business again, regardless of the good food. There's a way to treat customers properly and they never succeed at it.
author: Courtney W.

description: They delivered fairly quickly, which I wasn't expecting. Pizza was hot, and tasted good. Not the greatest I've ever had, but good for the price and the timing.
author: Tim W.

description:
Best Pizza i have ever had!! and I eat a lot of pizza.  They also make awesome sandwiches. Bring a sweater, it's always cold in there

Real mom and popish. Have to try it!!
author: Tyler A.

description:
5 stars for awesome pizza
5 stars for quick delivery
5 stars for not being impatient with me cuz i was quite inebriated...

soo my friend and I got really hungry while we were at baker beach. We started to wonder if food could be delivered there, so we tried. I whipped out my iphone and proceeded to look on yelp for some close by locations... I chose this place, called them, and asked for their pizza that has olives, mushrooms, salami, pepperoni, sausage, red onions, bell beppers, and pineapples. He recommended the Capricorn and he said they could add pineapples to it. I said yes, and ordered a medium sized pizza. (8 slices). With 2 cans of soda and the pizza, the total was about $22. It was SO good. Not kidding. Fresh ingredients, Buttery and chewy crust (and im not a crust eater AT ALL). ahh

Great experience with this place. Good good good pizza!
author: Bonita C.

description:
Oh Hi there Mr. Mushroom & Pineapple pizza from Pizza Joint....

You're so tasty and delicious!...the flavor of your crust reminds me of my childhood Pizza Hut Pizzas...yet you're not as greasy so I'm able to trick myself into thinking you're good for me. 

I like that you're not as expensive as the other pizzas in SF and we seem to get along well when it comes to the cheese vs. toppings ratio. I like that you came to my house quickly (tho you're only two blocks away to start).

Let's meet up again soon. K? My friends and I enjoyed having you around...and we miss you a lot already.
author: Katy A.

description: Can't believe I just found this place the other day. Love the prices and menu built for high schoolers. I also hear the specialty pizzas are good but I haven't gotten that far yet.
author: Chancelor D.

description:
I like plain cheese pizza because you can't go wrong. I bought a slice from here and it looked old. They were nice and heated it up for me, which was later followed up with a dash of pepper flakes and garlic powder.

After making the 2 minute drive home, I ate the pizza and it just wasn't very good. I usually really like crust and I didn't even finish it.

Maybe I need to try something else.
author: Katherine F.

description:
Pizza Joint is fantastic. First off, they deliver, and quickly, and don't sass you even if you want them to deliver a small cheese pizza and nothing else - which, after tip, is around $12. 

I'm not sure anything else needs to be said here: Cheap, fast, delicious. Score.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
One of my favorite quick eateries in San Francisco.

ALL sandwiches $3.50!  $4.00 with cheese - quite worth the upcharge.

The sandwiches are a generous portion and made with pride.  The cold cuts and cheeses are of good quality.  

I've never tried the pizza.  I'm from NY so I'm biased anyway.  But it looked and smelled good.

Pizza Joint will deliver with a $12 minimum.  

I met the owner, Joe, today, and he, like his staff, is very friendly and a positive influence in the neighborhood.

Definitely check out Pizza Joint.  It's fast becoming the go-to spot for everyone in my house.
author: Anthony L.

description: Terrible customer service.  They refused to to accept a coupon that they gave me off a flyer a week before I orderd the pizza.  They claimed it had expired, but there was no expiration date on the coupon.  Being really hungry, I just paid for my average pizza.  Round Table is about the same price and tastes way better.  Avoid this place.
author: Tanmaya H.

description: GET THE MOTHERF**KIN SHRIMP ALFREDO PIZZA. GET THAT SH*T! Pizza here is good. But I especially like it for that shrimp pizza. Best creation ever. Pasta sucks but they give a a large portion. I suggest calling ahead of time if you order to go. This place is open til 3am on the weekends and parking sucks.
author: Brigitte M.

description: This place is very unprofessional. I ordered a pizza and after waiting for one hour I called to ask about the delivery time. At this point in time they told me that they don't deliver tomorrow address even though it's only three minutes away. And I have previously ordered pizza from them before.  I will never eat there again. The pizza is mediocre and the only reason I ordered it the first time is because the price is reasonable. I wish I could give this place a negative stars but that's not an option..
author: Mahesh F.

description:
I pretty good place for pizza & some othe foods 

often at noon time when school isn't over it usalley busy and filled quickly

food : 4/5
service : 5/5
location : 3/5
author: Eric W.

description: Love the pizzas.  The crust is simply outstanding, and this comes from someone who never eats pizza crusts.  Ingredients seem fresh and delivery is prompt.  Best of all the prices are fantastic.
author: Evan M.

description: The pizza and the service at this little pizza place is great.  The guys were friendly and service was fast (about 15 minutes).  If you ask for a take-out menu, there are a few coupons on it that help save a couple of bucks.  We got a extra large (18") pizza with two toppings for $17.99 with coupon (and yes my husband and I can eat an extra large just between the two of us....what can I say I love pizza).  The crust was really tasty, was neither too thick or too thin, and had a nice chewiness to it.  They did not skimp on the sauce, cheese, or toppings, and overall the pizza was satisfying and delicious.  They have many special pizzas based on the horoscope (a large ranges around $22 to 24 but use the coupons!) and we will definitely go back to try those.
author: Ailene M.

description: I stumbled in here at lunch time, starving and desperate. Not knowing the neighborhood, I almost ate at Taco Bell, it was that bad. I ended up with two excellent slices of pepperoni pizza that were just what I'd wanted even though I was ready to eat my shoe. The crust in particular is great, a lot like a good fresh ciabatta.
author: evan a.

description:
Okay outer richmond kind of sucks for pizza.  However we just ordered from these guys last night and was blown away.  Polite people on the phone.  Pizza was well priced.  Pizza was brilliant.  These guys are under new management and they get my vote.  We will be ordering from them again.  The different crusts and menu toppings were amazing.  Holy crap.  It was good.
Nick
author: Nick T.

description:
Hmm. I'm conflicted about this joint. 

Sundays are when I'm at my ultimate sleepiest, and after a long day of work when my roomie mentioned pizza, I knew it needed some in or around my mouth. She mumbled something about Domino's and I said "blasphemy! We live in SF, not the suburbs of hell. I'm not eating that!" and I remembered I had seen this place a couple times and decided to give it a shot.

They guy on the phone was nice but after I asked for delivery it was silent for much too long- I thought he hung up on me and decided it was for the better, but then wow! all of a sudden he was there. 

The pizza came fast, only about 30 mints, but then again I only live 10 blocks away... 

I opened the box like it was Christmas morning and I am a 5 year old boy who got a Barbie Doll instead of micro machines (do they still have those?) The pizza didn't look great- it looked like store bought crust and safeway pepperoni.. but i was WRONG!

It tasted good good gooooood! I was confused still whenever I looked at it, but when I closed my eyes and savored the goodness, all was well. 

Although it was good, I don't know if I would order from here again. I love me some Seniores and Nizarios, but thought I should branch out- with good and bad results. 

Either way, keep doing what you're doing PJ.
author: Sarah C.

description: A solid place for delivery. I accidentally ordered from here even though I was out of their delivery area. They delivered anyway in a short amount of time. My pizza was piping hot and it was great, especially for the price. I felt so bad about being out of their delivery area once i learned about it but the driver was so gracious.
author: Jessica C.

description: grabbed a slice today as I was around the area. The crust was very, very crunchy (good if you like that sort of thing). The sauce was nice and tasty. The slice was ginormous! Imagine a costco slice times 2, and that's how big it was. Slice plus a drink around $5. If around the area, will visit again.
author: Dom L.

description: This place has awful buffalo wings.  It is an insult to call them buffalo wings.  This is false advertising.  The first thing wrong with them is that they are breaded.  Buffalo wings are not breaded, this is kfc wings.  The second thing wrong is that they weren't even spicy.  Lame!
author: Mr Buffalo Wings S.

description:
Sorely disappinted.  

Ordered a medium vegetarian pizza, total about $19.  Crust was good but entire rest of pizza was very soggy w/ no crispiness, ended up throwing it away.  Pretty poor quality ingredients on top.

On the upshot, we got delivery and it arrived right away and still hot.
author: Rainforest C.

description: Best in the West!!! I love this pizza, ask for thin crust and well done. You will be amazed. It's even good when it's cold for leftovers. Joe and Wally are cool and make the food with love. So roll out and hit the pizza joint...
author: Alex D.

description: Standing alone down the hill from Washington High School (where my parents met) is Pizza Joint.  Basically a take out place, it enjoys more space due to its locations and has 10 or so tables to sit at.  Because it is relatively isolated, the pizza slices do sit for awhile.  $2.50 for my traditional cheese slice.  I liked the light sprinkling of cheese on the outer crust and the sauce was solid.  A large slice but it cannot be described as thin crust.  A bit too bready for my tastes but again that's me.  Clean place, good service, soft drinks only.
author: Jeff J.

description: Egh the pizza is whatever. I had them deliver and it was ok. By the time the pizza got to my house it was barely warm. It lacked any real flavor. For the same price Pizza Orgasmica is the way to go.
author: Darius A.

description: Fast free delivery. Tasty pizza! It really is the best delivery in the outer Richmond area. Also the pizza has the best crust in comparison with some of the other places out here.
author: Roberta B.

description: Amazing zah! Nice crispy (but not dry) crust and a little bit of spice. Seriously some of the best.  I got the combo slice which was generously loaded with quality toppings. Highly recommend.
author: Will S.

description: As you can see this is my first post. i decided to try out these guys a few times before opening a yelp account to review them. the truth is, there is no more point in waiting. i have now ordered pizza from them at least 12 times and haven't been dissappointed once. one time they ran out of sausage which is my Numero uno topping choice so the guy on the phone offered me a free can of soda for the inconvenience. They are worth a try!
author: Arthur S.

description: I love this place! My girlfriend and I have been ordering from them fairly regularly, and have been completely satisfied. The pizzas and staff have been top notch and the prices are very reasonable!
author: Lawrence P. W.

description: My quest for respectable pizza in SF continues.  This place bakes bread with chesse, sauce, and toppings, not pizza. The unbearable thick crust is a doughy heavy flavorless disaster.  My pie had just a sad sprinkle of partially melted chesse. The pizza is better proposed as a paper weight than food.
author: lisa g.

description: we love pizza joint because of the crust.  now i am giving it 5*  because it is so darn goooooooood!!!
author: g m.

description: not baaaaad!  hubby took a chance and brought home a lovely pizza pie for us to eat and wow...not baaaaad!  don't let the looks of this place fool you :)
author: Emy B.

description: so yummy! i got a grilled turkey sandwich and a drink and i was only six bucks! the guys that work there are really friendly and the service was great. i am getting it again tonight :) they do have weird hours though so check online or call first
author: Marceline K.

description: My boyfriend took me here to grab some lunch, we split a mushroom pizza it was awesome! The crust was just right, not too thin not too fat and  it tasted great. I think this is a really cute pizza place that I would definitely come back to again, its very affordable and in a great area (close to golden gate park) so if you are up for a picnic at the park, this is the place to go to get some food!
author: Katherine M.

description: Never had the Pizza.  I'm a regular buyer of their oven baked sandwiches, which are only 3.99 plus extra for cheese or bacon and stuff.  Quality of sandwich and low price is un-matched.  They also have specialty sandwiches, which I haven't tried.
author: Luke S.

description: Probably the best pizza in the city, the crust has a bit of a crunch to it, the sauce has a bit of a tang to it, and the cheese doesnt have a layer of oil on it. Fast delivery with your order, reasonable prices and courteous workers.
author: Joshua L.

description: The pizza is pretty good. Knocking two stars off because they handle the money and the food interchangeably.
author: Lucy N.

description:
My first try here didn't start off so good.  When I called in an order, the guy on the phone sounded like he would rather be anywhere else but working the phone at Pizza Joint.  Using a menu that was hung on my door perhaps quite a while ago, I ordered a pizza with ground beef, mushrooms and yellow onions.

He said they were out of ground beef and yellow onions.  Would I like red onions?

So I guess he was trying to be helpful with the red onion suggestion, but it was kind of comical that they were out of what I would think are basic ingredients that were on this (old) menu.  It was a Sunday evening about 6:45 PM.  OK, so maybe they run out over a weekend, but that's still kind of poor planning.

Anyway, the pizza was promised in 40 - 45 minutes, but actually arrived in about 30.

Very tasty mushroom pizza.  I'll agree with another review that it was a bit wet.  The hand-tossed crust was pretty thin in the middle, though generous around the edge.  Either the sauce or mushroom juice or both had made the center soggy.  But other than that, the pizza was excellent.  I'm looking forward to reheating leftovers in the oven, perhaps crisping up the center of the crust a little bit.

The cheese was generous, but didn't quite reach the crust on the edge (some bare tomato sauce was visible around most of the edge).  This meant that the cheese would slide off the slice while eating from the center.

Minus 1 star for:  soggy middle of the pie. not spreading the cheese beyond the sauce to anchor it, toppings out of stock, low enthusiasm on the phone & no web page (so I could be sure I was looking at a current menu).

Even so, this was quite tasty.  I'll order again.
author: Jon L.

description: This pizza was great! I don't know what people are complaining about, this crust is delicious.  Everything is delicious.  My only problem is the fact that they told us they would deliver in 45 to 60 minutes, and it took about 90 minutes.  Still hot when it got here, though.  Overall, a good experience.
author: M A.

description: It tastes like microwaved pizza. 2 times in a row they screwed up my order. Not giving them my business anymore.
author: J R.

description: This was the worst pizza EVER!  I could have gotten a better pizza out of a trash can.  What an absolute waste of money.  This pizza even smelled bad.  I would rather eat dirt than one single bite of the pizza from this joint.
author: Cheryl F.

description: Okay this place is on my road, I must say. Its my new pizza place. I can't stop ordering the Sagittarius
author: Ray C.

description: I'm new to San Francisco and have only been in the city for two weeks.  I was hungry for Pizza and had no idea where to go. When I yelped "pizza" for my area (Outer Richmond)  Pizza Joint came up and I started to read the reviews. My buddy NICK T gave it a great review so I thought I would give it a try. I ordered a Large #1 (Supreme Pizza)  and had it delivered.  The delivery was on time (40 min) and the pizza was AMAZING.  I have to say I have had many pizza's in my time,  but this Supreme Pizza was Superb! The beast pizza I have ever had. All the topping were fresh and there were many of them.  It is a bit pricy (22.00)  but WELL WORTH IT!!  I will definitely be getting my pizza here from now on. LOVE IT!  Welcome to the city!!
author: Brad B.

description: This pizza is fantastic!! The crust, in particular, is heavenly. Highly recommended!
author: L T.

description: I really like their pizza, have ordered it 3 times to pick up.  It's hot, fresh, chewy cheese, an authentic NY pizza.  Crust was just about right, not too thick.  I use their $10.99 coupon for a large plain cheese, but its also good for a large pepperoni.  Excellent!  Not the best I have ever had but right up there.  The cheese is a bit on the salty side.  I don't like salt... it's something people should be allowed to add on their own, like pepper, and I wish restaurants would remember that.  Salt is not a healthy thing. Pizza is unhealthy enough with all that saturated fat... but it's my weakness and this is as good as any in the city.  Excellent overall and for $10.99, can't be beat.
author: martin c.
